questions.question:
If \(f(x_{i}).f(x_{i+1}) \lt 0\) then

(GATE CSE 1987)
options:
A.

There must be a root of f(x) between \(x_i\) and \(x_{i+1}\)

B.

There need not be a root of f(x) between \(x_{i}\) and \(x_{i+1}\).

C.

There fourth derivative of f(x) with respect to x vanishes at \(x_{i}\).

D.

The fourth derivative of f(x) with respect to x vanishes at \(x_{i+1}\).
questions.correct_answer:
A.

There must be a root of f(x) between \(x_i\) and \(x_{i+1}\)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow
